added_requirements.statement: System SHALL NOT display sensitive information (passwords, API keys, personal data) in logs, error messages, or terminal output.
added_requirements.rationale: Protects user privacy and security by preventing accidental exposure of sensitive data

added_requirements.statement: System SHALL NOT allow multiple simultaneous authorization requests for the same action from different AI agents.
added_requirements.rationale: Prevents conflicting authorization decisions and maintains decision integrity

added_requirements.statement: WHILE server is running, system SHALL NOT lose queued questions when server restarts or experiences temporary failures.
added_requirements.rationale: Ensures reliability of human-in-the-loop interactions by preserving pending requests

added_requirements.statement: System SHALL NOT allow unauthorized access to channel communications or message contents.
added_requirements.rationale: Maintains isolation between different workflows and prevents cross-channel interference

added_requirements.statement: System SHALL NOT store authorization decisions without associated timestamps.
added_requirements.rationale: Ensures auditability and prevents replay attacks by maintaining temporal context

added_requirements.statement: System SHALL NOT fail silently - all errors SHALL be reported to the requesting AI agent with descriptive messages.
added_requirements.rationale: Ensures reliable error handling and prevents silent failures that could cause AI agents to hang

added_requirements.statement: System SHALL NOT process commands from AI agents when the server is in an inconsistent state (startup, shutdown, or error recovery).
added_requirements.rationale: Prevents corrupted interactions during system transitions and maintains data integrity

added_requirements.statement: System SHALL NOT allow channel names that could cause conflicts or security issues (reserved names, special characters, excessive length).
added_requirements.rationale: Prevents operational issues and maintains system stability through input validation
